name: dish
content:
dish noun
(CONTAINER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 [ C ] a container, flatter than a bowl and sometimes with a lid, from which food can be served or which can be used for cooking: an oven-proof dish See also
satellite dish
Firmafotografen/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages the dishes A2 [ plural ]
all the plates, glasses, knives, forks, etc. that have been used during a meal: do/wash the dishes Have you done/washed the dishes?
See more
More examplesFewer examplesThere's no butter left in the butter dish.When you have rolled out the pastry, place it in a pie dish.Shred the lettuce and arrange it around the edge of the dish.Are you sure this dish is ovenproof?I keep the serving dishes in that cupboard in the corner.

dish noun
(FOOD)
A2 [ C ] food prepared in a particular way as part of a meal: a chicken/vegetarian dish
More examplesFewer examplesHere's a dish I prepared earlier.It takes a long time to prepare the dish but the results are so good that it's worth the effort.It's a simple dish to prepare, consisting mainly of rice and vegetables.I had the the most expensive dish on the menu - a choice fillet of fish.He concocted the most amazing dish from all sorts of unlikely ingredients.

dish noun
(ATTRACTIVE PERSON)
[ S ] old-fashioned a sexually attractive person: He's gorgeous - what a dish!
dish the dirt
to tell people unpleasant or shocking personal information about someone: dish the dirt on She agreed to dish the dirt on her ex-husband for a large fee.
See more
dish verb
(SPORTS)
[ I or T ] US informal in team sports such as basketball or ice hockey, to pass the ball to another player in your team: dish off to He skated down the right wing, dishing off to Owen for a slam-dunk goal. She can improve at dishing the ball, making decisions, and shooting from midrange.
More examplesFewer examplesHe's more likely to be the one to dish to that open shooter. She scored 17 points, grabbed 7 rebounds, and dished off 3 assists. It's frustrating to see him skilfully bring up the puck only to have no one to dish it to.

dish noun [C]
(CONTAINER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a round, flat container with a raised edge, used for serving or holding food
The dishes are all the plates, glasses, knives, forks, etc., that have been used during a meal: Who’s going to do the dishes (= clean the plates, glasses, etc.)?
dish noun [C]
(FOOD)
a particular type of food or food prepared in a particular way as part of a meal: This restaurant serves both Cuban and Chinese dishes.
